head.supplied: Botan. Garden 10/7/68 ¶ Dear Sir ¶ ¶ When planting the willow cuttings on the Melbourne side of the Yarra I had to employ a boatman from time to time to bring the cuttings across; for his services I ...

div.p: Unit 733, VPRS 3181/P Town Clerk's file series 1, VA 511 Melbourne, Public Record Office, Victoria.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Arial; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p: MS written by Ernst Heyne and signed by M. Botan. Garden 10/7/68

When planting the willow cuttings on the Melbourne side of the Yarra I had to employ a boatman from time to time to bring the cuttings across; for his services I have paid £1.5.0. for which a/c I hold a receipt. Have you not got some Incidental Vote available to which this sum could be charged. When planting the bank above the bathing house (which is being done now) the same service ought I should think be performed gratuitously by the keeper of the establishment.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Arial; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva, Arial; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

font-family: Geneva, Arial; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
E. G. Fitzgibbon Esq
M's letter was read at a meeting of the Melbourne City Council Health Committee, 15 July 1868: 'Ordered that the amount be paid by the City Treasurer out of petty cash.' (Unit 1, VPRS 4039, PROV).
